tutorial.title: Destructuring
tutorial.descriptionContent: Learn how to destructure Objects and Arrays.

lessons.title: Intro
lessons.interactiveContent:
Utilizing elements of arrays happens often, but it quickly becomes unwieldy to always refer to the elements by their index number.

Look at the example here. Use the first and second elements of cars to fill in the if and else if conditions.

Make sure to pick cars[0], followed by cars[1].

lessons.title: Arrays Destructuring Intro
lessons.interactiveContent:
Destructuring allows us to assign array items to variables to use like any other variable. It's the cleanest way to simplify our code.

We store new variables in [] and assign them to the original array cars.

Make sure to pick cars, followed by cars.

lessons.title: Basic Destructuring 1
lessons.interactiveContent:
The first element inside the [], companyName, corresponds to the first element in the array, Leo Pizza.

After destructuring, we can use companyName like any other variable.

Make sure to pick companyName, followed by companyName.

lessons.title: Basic Destructuring 2
lessons.interactiveContent:
The second element inside the [] , phone, corresponds to the second element in the array, 19873456789.

Make sure to pick phone, followed by phone.

lessons.title: Basic Destructuring 3
lessons.interactiveContent:
Finally, The third element inside the [], address, corresponds to the third element in the array, 911 SW Main St, Bunkie.

Make sure to pick address, followed by address.

lessons.title: Assign the Rest
lessons.interactiveContent:
If we don't want to destructure every element in the array, we can save the rest in anyOtherVariable by using ... before anyOtherVariable.

Make sure to pick . followed by . and then ., anyOtherVariable.

lessons.title: Extract values
lessons.interactiveContent:
The , inside the [] skips variables in the destructuring array's first and second positions.

We extract the array's third element in address.

Make sure to pick ,, followed by ,.

lessons.title: Question: Basic Destructuring
lessons.interactiveContent:
What is the basic process of destructuring an array?

Using square brackets [] to store the variables corresponding to the array elementsUsing curly braces with the exact name of the element

Using square brackets [] to store the variables corresponding to the array elements.

lessons.title: Question: Assign the Rest
lessons.interactiveContent:
What kind of datatype is extraInfo?

An arrayAn object

An array.

lessons.title: Question: Extract values
lessons.interactiveContent:
What's the purpose of the commas in this code?

Skip the first, third, and fourth elements of the arrayKeep the remaining items we are not using in the destructure in an new array

Skip the first, third, and fourth elements of the array.

lessons.title: Example: Basic Destructuring
lessons.interactiveContent:
Let's destructure this array using the variables companyName, phone, and address.

Make sure to pick companyName,, followed by phone,, and finally address.

lessons.title: Example: Assign the Rest
lessons.interactiveContent:
Let's destructure the first element of this array with the variable id and keep the remaining elements in the array moreInfo.

Make sure to pick id, followed by . and then ., ., moreInfo.

lessons.title: Example: Extract values
lessons.interactiveContent:
Destructure the array's first, second, and fourth elements in the variables id, userName, and favoriteFruit.

Make sure to pick id, followed by userName, and then ,, favoriteFruit.

lessons.title: Objects Destructuring Intro
lessons.interactiveContent:
Destructuring simplifies the use of array items, and we can use this functionality with objects too!

We can extract an object’s values into new variables using braces {}.

lessons.title: Basic Destructuring
lessons.interactiveContent:
The three variables inside the {} correspond to the three values in the object.

Use the exact names of the properties for the variables in the destructuring.

Make sure to pick firstName, followed by lastName, and finally age.

lessons.title: Different variable name
lessons.interactiveContent:
We use the original property name, a colon, and a new name if we want to use variable names that differ from the object’s properties.

Make sure to pick item1, followed by :, and finally brand.

lessons.title: Assign the Rest
lessons.interactiveContent:
To separate the first and second values, and keep the rest of the object together, add ... and otherInfo after the first two properties.

Make sure to pick ..., followed by otherInfo.

lessons.title: Question: Basic Destructuring
lessons.interactiveContent:
What is the basic process of destructuring an object?

Using curly braces with the exact name of the object propertiesDeclaring a variable and assigning the object directly

Using curly braces with the exact name of the object properties.

lessons.title: Question: Different variable name
lessons.interactiveContent:
How can we customize the variable names we use in an object destructure?

Including a colon and the new name next to the variable name to changeNot including

Including a colon and the new name next to the variable name to change.

lessons.title: Question: Assign the Rest
lessons.interactiveContent:
What datatype is rest?

An objectA string

An object.

lessons.title: Example: Basic Destructuring
lessons.interactiveContent:
Destructure the airplanes object.

Make sure to pick brand, followed by model, and finally enginesQty.

lessons.title: Example: Different variable name
lessons.interactiveContent:
We received an object with a variable name that's too general. Store the engine property as engineBrand.

Make sure to type engineBrand.

lessons.title: Example: Assign the Rest
lessons.interactiveContent:
We split out engineBrand but need to keep the rest of the object. Store these additional properties in extraInfo.

Make sure to pick . followed by . and then ., extraInfo.

lessons.title: Intro
lessons.interactiveContent:
The destructuring syntax makes it possible to unpack values from arrays, or properties from objects, into variables.

Let’s explore some applications of destructuring: setting default values, and sending destructed parameters to functions.

lessons.title: Default Values in Arrays
lessons.interactiveContent:
We can set default values when we're unsure whether an unpacked element value exists, or is set to undefined.

Make sure to pick =, followed by 1.

lessons.title: Default values in Objects
lessons.interactiveContent:
Like with arrays, we can set a default value to ensure an object has a value for a property we need.

Make sure to pick firstName, followed by =, and finally "Kori".

lessons.title: Functions in Arrays
lessons.interactiveContent:
We can destructure arrays when we are defining the function parameters.

Notice the first two items of the cookwareMaterials array as destructed parameters for getCookwareMaterials.

Make sure to pick first, followed by second.

lessons.title: Functions in Objects
lessons.interactiveContent:
The customGreeting function needs firstName and lastName from userInformation. We destructure the object to define the function parameters.

Make sure to pick firstName, followed by lastName.

lessons.title: Default values in Functions
lessons.interactiveContent:
We can set a default value to ensure age has a value inside the function.

Make sure to pick age, followed by =, and finally 39.

lessons.title: Question: Default values in Arrays
lessons.interactiveContent:
If you set a default value for a variable in a destructuring, but the unpacked element already has a value, what will be in the variable?

The unpacked element valueThe default value

The unpacked element value.

lessons.title: Question: Default values in Objects
lessons.interactiveContent:
What is the purpose of using default values?

Setting a value in case the element doesn't exist or is set to undefinedChanging the values of all the unpacked elements

Setting a value in case the element doesn't exist or is set to undefined.

lessons.title: Question: Functions in Arrays
lessons.interactiveContent:
What syntax do you use to pass destructed parameters from an array to a function?

square brackets []curly braces {}

square brackets [].

lessons.title: Question: Functions in Objects
lessons.interactiveContent:
What does the function customGreeting print?

Hi! My name is Remi Bietks, I am 34Hi! My name is Bietks, I am 34

Hi! My name is Remi Bietks, I am 34.

lessons.title: Example: Default values in Arrays
lessons.interactiveContent:
Our daily activities array needs four activities. Add the default value "exercise" for extramileTask.

Make sure to pick =, followed by "exercise".

lessons.title: Example: Default values in Objects
lessons.interactiveContent:
Set the default value for website. Assign www.callcentersupport.com.

Make sure to pick =, followed by 'www.callcentersupport.com'.

lessons.title: Example: Functions in Arrays
lessons.interactiveContent:
Send the third and fourth items of highlightTalks as destructed parameters for sendAdvertisement.

Use the variables names versionControl and versionControlPlatform.

Make sure to pick versionControl, followed by versionControlPlatform.

lessons.title: Example: Functions in Objects
lessons.interactiveContent:
Send attendees as a destructed parameter for getScholarshipsQty.

Make sure to type attendees.
